title: Bio
text:
Pablo Serrano received his M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in Telecommunications Engineering from Universidad Carlos III de Madrid (UC3M) in 2002 and 2006, respectively. He joined the UC3M Telematics Engineering Department in 2002, where he is currently a Full Professor. Throughout his tenure, he has held numerous leadership roles, including Director of the Department, Director of the Master’s in Connected Industry 4.0, and his current role as Deputy Director for Infrastructure, Digitalization, and Sustainability at the Polytechnic School.
With over 100 peer-reviewed publications in flagship venues such as IEEE/ACM Transactions on Networking, IEEE INFOCOM, and IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing, Professor Serrano is a recognized expert in wireless network analysis and protocol design. He has served on the TPC for conferences like IEEE INFOCOM and Globecom, and held editorial roles for IEEE Communications Letters and Elsevier Computer Networks. Currently, he is an Associate Editor for IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing, Elsevier Computer Communications, and Oxford’s The Computer Journal.
His research leadership includes serving as Principal Investigator for 8 projects and 8 research contracts, with additional participation in over 40 national and international initiatives. His work has influenced industry standards, including contributions to the IETF, IEEE 802.11, and ETSI MEC, and he holds a patent for energy-saving 802.11 interfaces.
A Senior Member of the IEEE, Professor Serrano has held prestigious visiting positions at UMass Amherst, the University of Edinburgh, and Trinity College Dublin, supported by competitive grants such as the Salvador de Madariaga. His research, and that of his students, has been recognized with several Best Paper and Best Ph.D. Thesis awards.

title: Students
text:
Join the Lab: I am always looking for motivated PhD students and Postdocs interested in Wireless Networking and AI. If you are interested in my research, please send me your CV and a brief statement of interest. Do not forget to include my office number in the subject of your email.
I have the privilege of working with a talented group of researchers and students at UC3M.

title: Research
text: My research focuses on the design, analysis, and performance evaluation of wireless communication systems and networking protocols. I am particularly interested in the intersection of Machine Learning and Network Softwarization to enable the next generation of mobile networks (6G).

title: Research
text:
Key Research Areas

1. 6G and Open RAN (O-RAN)
We are investigating the “cloudification” of the Radio Access Network. Our work focuses on: * Resource Allocation: Using Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) for real-time radio resource management. * Serverless Networking: Exploring how FaaS (Function-as-a-Service) can be applied to mobile core functions to improve resiliency.


2. Applied Machine Learning in Networking
Bridging the gap between theoretical ML and practical networking constraints: * Digital Twins: Developing high-fidelity network replicas for testing security and performance without disrupting live traffic. * Data Privacy: Analyzing MAC address de-anonymization and developing privacy-preserving mobility data models.


3. Performance Evaluation of WLAN/5G
Long-standing expertise in the mathematical modeling and experimental validation of: * IEEE 802.11 (Wi-Fi) Evolution: Performance limits of high-density WLANs. * Network Slicing: Efficiently partitioning 5G resources to meet diverse Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
